{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, a rare case of hyperdontia suggests that under favourable conditions supernumerary teeth must not be extracted but can be fully included in the planning of orthodontic treatment. A retrospective study found that accepted UK orthodontic practice is to extract the supernumerary and provide sufficient space for the unerupted tooth to erupt spontaneously. However, another case report suggests that removal of the supernumerary tooth may lead to eruption of the impacted primary incisor. Considering these cases and their outcomes, it seems that immediate intervention with removal appliance could be a viable option for this patient.", "answer_choice": D}
